title: Rep. Joe Kennedy Will Challenge Ed Markey for Senate Seat
text:
WASHINGTON— Rep. Joe Kennedy III, a member of one of America’s great political dynasties, will challenge Ed Markey for his Massachusetts Senate seat, setting up a dogfight between two progressive lawmakers.

Mr. Kennedy’s formal announcement is expected on Saturday, according to a person familiar with Mr. Kennedy’s plans. Mr. Kennedy met with Mr. Markey on Wednesday to tell him that he planned to run, the person said.

Mr. Markey has served in the Senate since 2013, and has been in Congress since 1976, when he entered the House. He has said repeatedly in recent months that he plans to defend his seat.

“Elections are about choices, and Ed looks forward to spending the next 14 months campaigning hard every day to show the people of the Commonwealth why he’s the right choice,” said John Walsh, a senior campaign adviser. “From lowering drug prices for our seniors, to expanding opioid treatment and recovery services, to creating green jobs for our workers, Ed Markey is ready to continue the fight for Massachusetts.”

The Boston Globe first reported that Mr. Kennedy planned to announce his run.

Sen. Ed Markey has been endorsed for re-election by a list of state and national lawmakers. Photo: Alex Brandon/Associated Press

Mr. Markey has rolled out a list of endorsements from state lawmakers as well as national names, including Massachusetts Sen. Elizabeth Warren and Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez of New York, both Democrats.

But Mr. Kennedy, who is a grandson of former U.S. senator and attorney general Robert F. Kennedy, is prepared to pitch himself as a younger, newer face to represent the Bay State. The 38-year-old is in his fourth term in Congress, compared with 73-year-old Mr. Markey’s decades of service.

It remains to be seen what political path Mr. Kennedy will carve, as Mr. Markey is one of the more progressive Democratic senators in the caucus and has been outspoken on energy policy and climate change.

The person familiar with Mr. Kennedy’s plans said the representative has done at least one poll that showed him ahead outside of the margin of error.

Write to Natalie Andrews at Natalie.Andrews@wsj.com
description: Rep. Joe Kennedy III, a member of the famous political family, will challenge Ed Markey for his Massachusetts Senate seat, setting up a dogfight between two progressive lawmakers.
